message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: private class SequenceSelector implements Selector {
    private Iterator<T> iterator = items.iterator();
    private T obj = iterator.next();
    
    public boolean end() {
        return !iterator.hasNext();
    }
    
    public T current() {
        return obj;
    }
    
    public void next() {
        if (iterator.hasNext()) {
            obj = iterator.next();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your current implementation, you are creating a new iterator in each call to the next() method. This is why the iterator doesn't move and the program goes into an infinite loop. To fix this, you should create the iterator only once and then use it to move to the next element in the next() method.
